item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1025/comment-page-1#comment-2938">Waseem Sadiq</a>.
I sent you an e-mail directly about some of the performance issues I'm having with inbox2. It's hitting the CPU too hard right now.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Waseem Sadiq.

I sent you an e-mail directly about some of the performance issues I’m having with inbox2. It’s hitting the CPU too hard right now.

item.title: By: Waseem Sadiq
item.dc:creator: Waseem Sadiq
item.description:
We had this issue in an old version of Inbox2 (actually a bug in wpf), you should try reinstalling with the latest version from www.inbox2.com, and hey its free and will remain free :-)
Take care,
Waseem
item.content:encoded:
We had this issue in an old version of Inbox2 (actually a bug in wpf), you should try reinstalling with the latest version from http://www.inbox2.com/, and hey its free and will remain free :-)

Take care,

Waseem

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1025/comment-page-1#comment-2938">Waseem Sadiq</a>.
I had seen inbox2 (and I've got it installed) -- but having just purchased PostBox, I'm not too compelled to switch to something else. I just started it up as a reminder -- and it has hung on the splash screen for more than a minute. :(
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Waseem Sadiq.

I had seen inbox2 (and I’ve got it installed) — but having just purchased PostBox, I’m not too compelled to switch to something else. I just started it up as a reminder — and it has hung on the splash screen for more than a minute. :(

item.title: By: Waseem Sadiq
item.dc:creator: Waseem Sadiq
item.description:
Hi there,
Have you already seen Inbox2? www.inbox2.com, its a totally new email client which tries to do things differently. Still in beta but we hope quite useful already.
And guess what its built in WPF and actually contains some sample code found on this very blog :-)
Take care,
Waseem
item.content:encoded:
Hi there,

Have you already seen Inbox2? http://www.inbox2.com/, its a totally new email client which tries to do things differently. Still in beta but we hope quite useful already.

And guess what its built in WPF and actually contains some sample code found on this very blog :-)

Take care,

Waseem
